text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with suffering succotash salad with
barbecue dressing so much to my
amazement this is my new favorite cold
salad for the summer using some similar
ingredients - psycho - not exactly
succotash but that's okay because really
not that many people like succotash so
you should probably rename this
something I don't know a little sexier
more appealing than succotash salad but
that's why I'm calling it just because
you know I couldn't think of anything
else so check it out this starts with a
very simple very basic barbecue sauce
vinaigrette which is simply a couple
tablespoons of barbecue sauce I'm using
sfq but any barbecue sauce will work
something a little spicy I think would
be nice to that I'm going to add some
rice vinegar and some vegetable oil now
you could use a very light olive oil
here alright or just a regular light
salad oil I'm going to whisk that up
thanks to the viscosity of the barbecue
sauce this is going to emulsify very
quickly meaning the oil and vinegar are
not separate they are equal and together
alright then
the veggies are going to start going in
and the secret to this salads
deliciousness is this raw sweet corn do
not cook it do not grill it do not do
anything with it simply take a sharp
knife and shave the kernels off the cob
into your bowl you really want that cold
raw sweet crunch of the corn alright to
the corn I'm going to add one can of
rinsed white beans I'm going to add one
diced red bell pepper and four green
onions that I chopped up that's it oh by
the way at this point I was like wait a
minute I forgot to put the other yireh
corn in so I shaved another year of corn
in so there was two total I'm gonna toss
it with that dressing with that barbecue
sauce uh vinaigrette and that blue door
knot is done now you could serve this
right away but if you can let this sit a
couple hours toss it a couple times it
gets even better
and if you could do this overnight oh my
god the next day you're talking about a
seriously stupendous succotash salad and
I tasted this and I thought it was going
to be good but I had no idea was going
to be this good what a great combination
of textures the soft
smooth white beans the crunchy sweet
corn the crisp bittersweet peppers and
then that green onion to finish just
perfect this is like I got to bring
something to the barbecue or the picnic
and I don't know what to bring and I
don't have a lot of time or money this
is probably a great option okay so there
you go suffering succotash salad and of
course I said suffering because I'm
making fun of the old cartoon all right
but there's no suffering involved here
this is like the opposite of suffering
so anyway I hope you give this a try
head over to food whooshes calm from all
the ingredient amounts as usual and as
always enjoy
